title: Let's get started
text: Linear regression is a simple yet powerful way of estimating the relationship between variables. In simple linear regression we have a predictor, X, and a response, Y.

For example, let's say I want to measure the relationship between the number of times I pat my dog's head (the predictor variable) and her happiness - the number of times she wags her tail (the response variable).

- X (predictor): number of pats
- Y (response): number of wags

title: Predictor Variable
text: To start, I'll do an experiment, in which I pat her head multiple times. She enjoys this experiment a lot.
The X axis will represent the number of times I patted her head during each trial. Let's plot those points now.

title: Response Variable
text: Each of these predictor variables has a response associated with it. For each time I give her a certain number of pats, I count the number of wags. We can plot them on the same graph, with the wags being the new Y axis.
